form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Wyden introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To allow consumers to unlock mobile wireless devices for interoperability purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Wireless Device Independence Act of 2013.

section.header: Allowing consumers to unlock cell phones

subsection.text: Section 1201(a)(1)(B) of title 17, United States Code, is amended by striking not apply to persons and inserting the following: “not apply to—

clause.text: a user of a computer program, in the form of firmware or software, that enables a wireless telephone handset, or other wireless device that can connect to the Internet, originally acquired from the operator of a wireless telecommunications network or retailer to connect to a different wireless telecommunications network if—

subclause.text: the user legally owns a copy of the computer program;
the use of the computer program by the user is solely for the purpose of connecting to such wireless telecommunications network; and
the access to such wireless telecommunications network is authorized by the operator of the network; or

subsection.text: Section 1201(a)(1) of title 17, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (C), by striking subparagraph (B) and inserting subparagraph (B)(ii); and
in subparagraph (E), by striking Neither the exception and inserting Neither of the exceptions.

section.text: The amendments made by this Act shall take effect as if enacted on January 26, 2013.
